title:
Inspiring Read

The woman on the left is a mother from Miami who was so desperate to feed her hungry...

attachments.displayName:
Inspiring Read

The woman on the left is a mother from Miami who was so desperate to feed her hungry family that she was trying to steal a lot of food.
The woman on the right is Miami-Dade County Police Officer Vicki Thomas. Officer Thomas was about to arrest Jessica Robles but changed her mind at the last minute.

Instead of arresting her, she bought Robles $100 worth of groceries:

“I made the decision to buy her some groceries because arresting her wasn't going to solve the problem with her children being hungry.”

And there’s no denying they were hungry. Robles’ 12 year old daughter started crying when she told local TV station WSVN about how dire their situation was:

“[It's] not fun to see my brother in the dirt hungry, asking for food, and we have to tell him, ‘There is nothing here.’"

Officer Thomas says she has no question that what she did was right:

“To see them go through the bags when we brought them in, it was like Christmas. That $100 to me was worth it.”

But Officer Thomas did have one request:

“The only thing I asked of her is, when she gets on her feet, that she help someone else out. And she said she would.”

And guess what? The story gets even better.

After word got out about what happened people donated another $700 for Jessica Robles to spend at the grocery store.

And then best of all a local business owner invited her in for an interview and ended up hiring her on the spot as a customer service rep.

She started crying when he told her:

“There's no words how grateful I am that you took your time and helped somebody out. Especially somebody like me.”

And to think it all started with one veteran police officer trusting her “instinct” instead of going “by the book”.

Courtesy WSVN
Follow us for more awesome news like this:
Greg Rynerson Bail Bonds

And there’s no denying they were hungry. Robles’ 12 year old daughter started crying when she told local TV station WSVN about how dire their situation was:

Courtesy WSVN
Follow us for more awesome news like this:
Greg Rynerson Bail Bonds
There is still humans with hearts left on the planet. :)
That is just so inspiring.  I had tears reading that :)

This does not inspire me it makes me angry, so angry!! to think that we are so special so above the rest of life  on  this planet when in fact we are very low down the ladder; we can not respect the so called lower life how can we respect each other kindness is not only a human attribute the animal kingdom can show us more than a thing or two, i agree what this officer did is very very commendable but as it goes very isolated. (HUMANITY)

Humans are the lowest animal life form, considering the things we do to other animals & humans, but we all make that choice, I choose to do as officer, lost count of times I've paid for someones few grocieries or ice cream, drink etc, you start with yourself & if offered a "reward" refuse nicely & if person insisted, you get them to "pay it forward" simple.......now movie of same name, chek it out ;)

This is a very touching story.  We should expect more people needing help in our near future.  Congress is about to cut more women and children from social benefits.  Those that are hurting the most, due to not fault of their own, will soon receive the least.  Our elected officials need to be replaced with real people with compassion and who want to help.
Our recent change of government doesn't bode well either.  Given the behaviour of their state level associates in my state, I can see a lot of people facing some very difficult times. :(
